title: 'Broken stowage',
author: Bone, David W.
snippet: We left Leith Docks about midnight a black bitter midnight, with the wind strong east outside and a big sea rolling up the Firth and shattering on the pier-heads. I lingered to sec the town lights vanish into the mist astern and, feeling ill,

title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: Ten minutes after, Robert was being driven as fast as the best horse in Adamson's stables could travel towards Leith Docks. It was a fearfully tempestuous night.

title: Noctes ambrosianæ,
author: Wilson, John
snippet: Ambrose. Oh! dear — Oh! dear — Sirs, there's a rumour flying through the city that the bod}"- of Mr Tickler has been found drowned in one of the Leith Docks !^

title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: " Hech, but she was the bonny lassie, Maister Airmitage. But what was the maitter wi' her ? She was greetin' whan she got intil the caub, and she grot the hale road doon tae Leith Docks. I felt wae for her."

title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: "To Leith Docks? What did she want there?" asked Robert, in astonishment.
